Alee_(singer):
{{short description|Canadian country music singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Alee | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_date = | birth_name = Alexandra Adamoski | birth_place = [[Edmonton|Edmonton, Alberta]], Canada | origin = | instrument = {{hlist|Guitar|[[mandolin]]|piano}} | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2012–present | label = {{hlist|Little Red Truck|Gotta Be Alee|Wax}} | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|gottabealee.com/|gottabealee.com}} }} '''Alexandra Adamoski''', known professionally as '''Alee''', is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter. Alee released her independent debut album, ''This Road Goes Everywhere'', on July 18, 2013. The single "Don't Say You Love Me" reached the Top 25 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart, followed by a Top 20 hit with her 2015 single "Moonshine".{{cite news|last=Pederson|first=Casadie|title=Alee celebrates her first Top 25 single|url=http://topcountry.ca/alee-celebrates-her-first-top-30/|accessdate=November 29, 2013|newspaper=Top Country|date=March 27, 2013}} In August 2013, she won the [[Canadian Country Music Association]]'s Jiffy Lube FanFest Performance Contest, and was later nominated for the prestigious Rising Star Award in 2016, and Female Artist of the Year in 2017.{{cite news|last=Tinson|first=Kayla|title=Alee is the 2013 Jiffy Lube FanFest winner!|url=http://topcountry.ca/alee-announced-as-the-2013-jiffy-lube-fanfest-contest-winner/|accessdate=November 29, 2013|newspaper=Top Country|date=August 9, 2013}} Her debut label-supported album, ''[[Bad Habit (album)|Bad Habit]]'', was released in April 2017.{{cite web|last1=McElheran|first1=Taryn|title=Country artist Alee releases new video for "When I do" and announces new album|date=April 7, 2017 |url=http://canadianbeats.ca/2017/04/07/country-artist-alee-releases-new-video-for-when-i-do-and-announces-new-album/|publisher=Canadian Beats|accessdate=April 19, 2017}} She released her third album ''Feels Like This'' independently in 2021.{{cite web|url= https://thereviewsarein.com/2021/07/17/alee-releases-new-album-feels-like-this/|title=Alee Releases New Album, Feels Like This|date=July 17, 2021|first=Joshua|last=Murray|work=The Reviews Are In|access-date=December 12, 2022}} ==Discography== {{BLP sources section|date=August 2021}} ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !
